name: Opera Trivia Quiz | Other Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who commissioned and wrote the libretto for Mozart's 'The Magic Flute'?
What was Gounod's most famous sacred song?
Who wrote the opera called 'Dido and Aeneas'?
questions.explanation:
Purcell.

	Purcell was a British composer who wrote this opera in English. 'Dido and Aeneas' was created in 1689.

questions.text: Which of the following did not collaborate at some time or another with Jean-Baptiste Lully?
The father of which famous scientist was a member of the influential intellectual Florentine group called the 'Florentine Camerata' who collaborated together to develop the art of recitativo?
questions.explanation:
Galileo & Galileo Galilei & Galilei.

	Among this group included Jacopo Peri, who wrote the first opera, and composers Giulio Caccini and Emilio de Cavalieri.

questions.text: What is another term for jongleurs, in the historical sense of the word?
questions.explanation:
minstrels.

	Not strictly an opera question, but the minstrels or jongleurs were part of the evolution into opera in the west.

questions.text: Which term refers to a group of individuals hired by a performer or composer to sit amongst the audience and influence the audience's response?
Who wrote 'you know my greatest desire is to write operas...I envy anyone who is composing one' to his father?
questions.explanation:
Mozart.

	Mozart had a mixed relationship with his father, very devoted but also resentful.

questions.text: Verdi's opera 'Nabucodonosor' later became abbreviated as what?
Who created operas out of works by Henry James, Shakespeare and Herman Melville?
questions.explanation:
Benjamin Britten.

	'The Turn of the Screw', 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' and 'Billy Budd'.
